meanings.definition: A weapon for shooting arrows, typically made of a curved piece of wood with a taut string connecting the two ends.
meanings.sent1: The archer carefully pulled back the bows before releasing the arrow.
meanings.sent2: Hunters often use bows to hunt for food in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use the bows as a swing, but it didn't end well.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the bow that shot her dreams straight to the target.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bows releasing arrows echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: A gesture of respect or greeting, typically made by inclining the head and upper body.
meanings.sent1: He greeted the king with a deep bows as a sign of respect.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, people exchange bows instead of handshakes.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's awkward bow made everyone in the room chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her graceful bow conveyed more gratitude than words ever could.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized bows of the performers impressed the audience.

meanings.definition: A knot tied with two loops and two loose ends, used for tying shoelaces or packages.
meanings.sent1: She quickly tied her shoelaces with neat bows before heading out to play.
meanings.sent2: The gift was beautifully wrapped with a shiny ribbon and a big bow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the bows on the gift, unraveling them in seconds.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a tangled bow, difficult to unravel and understand.
meanings.sent5: The bow on the package added a touch of elegance to the simple brown box.
